title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: They ask for resume and statement of interest for graduate program you are applying to and hear back in one month. Once you accept, you can register for classes after you meet with your advisor.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in applying to University of Baltimore

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Baltimore
Interview Descriptions: Great interview with questions that one would expect. The interviews were done by individuals who really care about the students and their education.  An in-person interview accounted for most of the experience and I enjoyed meeting the hiring group.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching style?

title: Business Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: This position was a part of the HIDTA team in the CDPE at the University of Baltimore. I attended the first round which consisted of a panel of five members including Deputy Director, Internal auditors and finance manager. They asked 10 questions in total. Each interviewer asked 2 questions.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the HIDTA program?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Baltimore
Interview Descriptions: The interview was short. I was referred by another employee. They asked about the experience on my resume and asked why I wanted to work in this position. We went over my previous research experience.
Interview Questions: The interview was short. I was referred by another employee. They asked about the experience on my resume and asked why I wanted to work in this position.

title: Writing Center Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was very easy. I was offered the position without hassle. The hiring and interview process was very easy. I was offered the position without hassle.
Interview Questions: What type of writing experience do you have?

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a long time between when I submitted my application and got an email asking about interview availability. Had a 1-on-1 phone interview with the potential supervisor and was brought in for a second interview with a hiring committee of 6 people.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted the job, if I had experience working with diverse groups of people, to explain a marketing project I worked on.

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by three people who ran the departments, all of to whom I would report. They were friendly but inquisitive; only one person was slightly critical. All three of them reviewed my experience, openness to complete the kind of work they sought to do, and my future plans.
Interview Questions: Do I see myself with the company in the next five years, as I gain more education.

title: Assistant Registrar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the company's website and was called in for an interview within 3 weeks. here was a panel of four (including who would be my current supervisor) who tool turns asking basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why was I the best candidate for the job?

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Baltimore
Interview Descriptions: I too seemed to be brought in to meet some sort of hiring quota, and it was painfully obvious the staff had no interest in what I had to say. Very rude and disrespectful of my time. Also, HR is completely oblivious. They brought me in for a position that I was hardly qualified for, and denied my application for a position that I was overqualified for because on my degree is in an "unrelated" major. Very unprofessional recruitment process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job when you're not already doing this job somewhere else?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: Absolutely terrible. It was evident from the start that interviewing me was just a formality to fulfill some sort of hiring quota. The job had clearly already been filled as they were uninterested in what I had to say. Also, two of the members were late for the panel interview which is highly unprofessional.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions.

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Super short and straight to the point. I apply online through the job search portal, the Hiring manager got back to me through email and ask to interview me on a day that was good for me. A few days later, I came in to the location, we sat down and had the interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Housekeeper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Baltimore
Interview Descriptions: It starts with filling out the online application attached a resume and very good cover letter with good references. Then there is an interview and then in a couple of months you receive a callback or you don't
Interview Questions: What do you want to do in the next five years.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Baltimore in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had both a phone and then in-person with department and program chairs. I got the interview because a friend worked there at the time and recommended me because he believed I would be a good fit. I submitted an application and heard from them at the conclusion of the semester with apologies that things were hectic at the end of the semester.
Interview Questions: What courses have you taught and what would you like to teach?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was a series of phone calls with HR, a single interview and a long negotiation process for salary.  There was not much to it at all, and frankly a bit disappointing.  HR was extremely difficult and a bit rude, but management was decent to work with throughout the process.  You feel that HR is lying to you about salary the entire time and it starts the relationship off on the wrong foot.
Interview Questions: Average questions, nothing crazy.

title: Admission Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Baltimore in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: After turning in a resume and cover letter, was offered a phone interview followed by an on campus interview. Was given a quick tour of campus before presenting a power point slide show of the University to members of the Admission staff that I had prepared. There were questions from the gathered staff at that time followed by a sit down interview with the Director of Undergraduate Admission.
Interview Questions: How would you sell UB? (had to base off of information previously pulled from the website)

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was well organized with a well informed search committee.  A presentation was required and presented to both the committee and staff.  The highight was meeting with my future supervisor who was both engaging and informative.  The interview with the staff was congenial.  The only negative was the hotel accomodations.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite beverage?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was very comfortable and opened with general discussion, traffic etc. and then followed by more specific questions about my interest and abilities.

Following that we discussed why I liked sales and what problems I saw about myself.

I was also asked how I get along with my managers and how I respond to management.  I answered and asked the manager about his specific style.
Interview Questions: Why media advertising?

title: Library Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD) in Jul 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to apply for a fairly high level position by the chair of the search committee after a telephone screening. When I came for the group interview, it became clear that the search committee members were at odds with each other. I did not interview well, needless to say. I do feel that the whole process could have been handled more professionally.
Interview Questions: In which areas of the library would I hire additional personnel.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Baltimore (Baltimore, MD)
Interview Descriptions: They ask for resume and statement of interest for graduate program you are applying to and hear back in one month. Once you accept, you can register for classes after you meet with your advisor.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in applying to University of Baltimore
